content: customizable fingerless gloves the sky s the limit with these customizable fingerless gloves they re comfortable easy quick to knit up and just about any stitch pattern can be added to the back worked in the round with an even number of stitches all you would need to do is calculate the number of stitches you need for a stitch pattern and how big you want the design for the back to be go crazy with it yarn gauge 1 ball of paton s kroy fx 8 st/inch or any basic sock yarn 11r/inch gauge is important to plan a good fit but needles isn t wholly necessary guage is measured in body 9 circular needles us size 3 3 25 stockinette only mm or four double pointed needles dpn us size 3 3 25 mm finished measurements thumb gusset three double pointed 9 inches/23 cm long 5 25 inches/13 5 cm needles us size 3 3 25 mm or us size circumference 2 2 75 mm size will fit average adult notions glossary 2 stitch markers k knit pm place marker small sharp tapestry needle for weaving in p purl sm slip marker ends m1r make one right wyib - with yarn in m1l make one left back notes these gloves are worked in the round they re customizeable so i ve made this pattern to be very basic you can add any cable leaf or lace stitch pattern you can add or take away any row to accommodate your preferred length this pattern is ambidextrous and can also be knit two-at-a-time when adding a stitch pattern to the back divide the stitches with a stitch marker to 22 which will be the back of the glove 21 for the palm and 1 for the thumb gusset using a unique marker for the beginning of the round check out these websites for stitch pattern tutorials ideas if you want to add more elaborate style and uniqueness using 9 circular needles https //www youtube com/watch v=2xdq6k5wwtk http //newstitchaday com/category/stitchio join in the round https //www youtube com/watch v=i295-6w0qv4 nary/knitting-stitches/ m1l/r http //www knittingstitchpatterns com/ https //www youtube com/watch v=ilpqbhz31b4 http //www knittinghelp com/free-patterns/ backwards loop cast on categories/stitch-patterns https //www youtube com/watch v=ojou7bco4dm pattern quick tip cast on 44 stitches with your preferred method weave in your cast on end early by doubling it up join in the round making sure not to twist the with your working yarn when you join in the round stitches place marker work 15 stitches this doesn t look as bulky as you row 1 12 *k2 p2* repeat * to end of row sm think and it s practically invisible this will also help row 13 *slip the two knit stitches purl-wise wyib close the gap at the join p2* repeat * to end of row sm row 14 63 k1 all the way around to create stockinette sm quick tip row 13 is not a huge necessity but i added it from
